findings.title: Unencrypted Private Data On-Chain
findings.description: Access to Critical Private Variable via Public Method

findings.title: Message call with hardcoded gas amount
Hash Collisions with Multiple Variable Length Arguments
findings.description: This finding corresponds to CWE-294: Authentication Bypass by Capture-replay, which indicates a potential vulnerability related to hash collisions when dealing with multiple variable length arguments.

findings.title: Presence of unused variables
findings.description: Unused variables are present in the contract, which can lead to irrelevant code and potential security risks.

findings.title: Right-To Left Override control character (U+202E)
findings.description: The Right-To-Left override control character (U+202E) can be used to manipulate the visual representation of text, potentially leading to phishing attacks or other security issues.

findings.title: DoS With Block Gas Limit
findings.description: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption leading to Denial of Service (DoS) attack with block gas limit.

findings.title: Arbitrary Jump with Function Type Variable
findings.description: The finding indicates a vulnerability where an arbitrary jump can occur due to a function type variable, potentially leading to unintended code execution.

findings.title: Insufficient Gas Griefing
findings.description: Insufficient control flow management leading to potential gas griefing attacks.

findings.title: Incorrect Inheritance Order
findings.description: The contract has an incorrect inheritance order which can lead to unexpected behavior and security issues.

findings.title: Requirement Violation
findings.description: Improper Following of Specification by Caller (CWE-573)

findings.title: Lack of Proper Signature Verification
findings.description: Improper verification of cryptographic signature, making it vulnerable to signature replay attacks and malleability.
